channel.title: Class based starters, what should they have?
channel.description:
Alright, I've always been better at the code behind the server. I can never think of what should be in shops, what should be in drops, and definitely what should be in a starter.
I'm have a class-based starter system. Instead of the not-so-classic classic Range, Mage, and Melee starters, I wanted these 3: Skiller - Pker - Main (Both).
The skiller would (I assume) come with a bit more money than the pker (for raw materials and such), and I think would look like: 4 spots used for [hat][body][legs][boots] (Idk what to put :P) A tin, a chisel, a knife, Bronze + Iron hatchet and pickaxe, and some a basic starter pack of items (like a few seeds and shit).
Pker: A set of ghostly, and 2 sets of full rune. Some cash, and some weapons for pvp. Nothing skill related goes in this because, they don't want skills.
Main: This would be a mix of the two. Cash, as always, the skiller outfit, the ghostly outfit, and 1 set of rune. Plus some runes, arrows, and a couple scims.
What should I do to improve these, and obviously I need better ideas on the outfits.

item.title: Class based starters, what should they have?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:23, topic:528287”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=647035.msg4353911#msg4353911 date=1377134728]
Here’s my skiller starter:

How’s it look? (Yes, the cowhide in there can be crafted using the needle and thread :P)
[/quote]Too much thread. ;)[/quote]
I honestly forget why I gave 1k thread lol. I think the rune ess was supposed to be 1k, I’ma change it to 5, for the hides.
Edit:
Here’s my main’s kit, yes no?

item.source: Class based starters, what should they have?

item.title: Class based starters, what should they have?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:5, topic:528287”]tbh I’d have classes like Thief, Priest, and Knight because there are thousands of items you can use for each class, and you can have certain abilities and skills for each class:

Thief -

[ul][li]Skills: Ranged, Hitpoints, Defence, Thieving, Agility[/li]
[li]Abilities: (Magic bow spec), (Dark bow spec) etc.[/li]
[li]Equipment: Leather only, bows and daggers only[/li][/ul]

…and so on.

Anyone can make use of these classes even without client work, but just a few interface edits. Just adapt to the things you are given from the cache.

Starters should be the lowest leveled equipment you can find for each class.
[hr]
I really would love to help with this btw ;)[/quote]
Holy that is an amazing idea!

Read full topic
item.source: Class based starters, what should they have?

item.title: Class based starters, what should they have?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“JDETSC, post:18, topic:528287”]Another way to ruin your game.

Docent’s idea is the boss.[/quote]
Yes, because a class system is totally a way to ruin it.
I’ve played (Literally) at least a hundred servers, from super popular, to maybe 1 player online if you’re lucky.
I ask people a hypothetical question (well, not so hypothetical, but in a sense)
“If you could play a server that divided the skillers from pkers, would you?” at least 80% said yes.
Lots of servers have added the “pk” skill. Yeah, and people like myself (whom like to master the game by getting 99 in all and being rich etc but don’t like PK’ing) lose out on that feat because THEY DON’T PK.
So instead if you made a skill that was based off whether you PK or Skill or BOSS (Class based!) it would make it more fair and everyone could get what they want.

You could always add a class switcher (EX: You pay 1B to switch classes, and you don’t get a new starter.)

I see no way how this ruins my server.

Read full topic
item.source: Class based starters, what should they have?

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Arcik:

Can’t you just give them a bunch of gold so they can buy their own outfits etc from a shop or something?

The idea is that they earn the cash, but get an alright looking outfit from the getgo (just like the rest of the classes).
Of course there’s going to be a shop that sells better cloths and such for greater value.

item.title: Class based starters, what should they have?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:528287”][quote author=Null Amount link=topic=647035.msg4353517#msg4353517 date=1377063017]

Skillers should have a set of skilling related items (tinderbox, chisel, hammer, iron pickaxe/axe, etc) and a few raw materials (maybe 50 logs and 25 of both copper and tin ore).

PKers should get a basic set of melee armor: full iron set, ghostly robes, climbing boots, amulet of glory, maybe 50-75K coins to purchase any other items needed.

Mains should get the same items as skillers minus the raw materials, a full set of iron, ghostly robes, climbing boots, amulet of strength, and maybe 25K coins.

ILY
What’s about a outfit for the skiller though?
[/quote]You could just give them a very basic aesthetic outfit (mime outfit, Laederhosen, camo) that gives no additional bonuses.

Yeah but I was looking for a cool one, I had one of those in mind actually :P[/quote]I like the tribal clothes (sandals, tribal top, etc) and I don’t think they give a bonus.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:6, topic:528287”]I added sort of unimplemented classes to my server. The characters look really cool too. Here are my classes.

Knight - Steel Full Helm, Holy Symbol, Steel Platebody, Silverlight, Holy Book, Steel Platelegs, Leather Boots, Leather Gloves.

Monk - [No Helm], Holy Symbol, Monk Robe Top, Steel Mace, Holy Book, Monk Robe Bottoms, Leather Boots, Leather Gloves.

Wizard - Blue Wizard Hat, Amulet of Magic, Wizard Robe Top, Staff of Air, Holy Book, Blue Skirt, Leather Boots, Leather Gloves.

Dark Wizard (Wizard Variant) - Ahrim’s Hood, Unholy Symbol, Dark Wizard Top, Mystic Mud Staff, Unholy Book, Black Skirt, Leather Boots, and Leather Gloves.

Archer - Robin Hood Hat, Holy Symbol, Leather Body, Maple Shortbow, Green D’hide Chaps, Leather Boots, Leather Vambraces.

If you like em you can use em :D[/quote]
I’m looking specifically for the classes I posted above. Sorry.

[quote=“wildskiller, post:5, topic:528287”]tbh I’d have classes like Thief, Priest, and Knight because there are thousands of items you can use for each class, and you can have certain abilities and skills for each class:

Thief -

[ul][li]Skills: Ranged, Hitpoints, Defence, Thieving, Agility[/li]
[li]Abilities: (Magic bow spec), (Dark bow spec) etc.[/li]
[li]Equipment: Leather only, bows and daggers only[/li][/ul]

…and so on.

Anyone can make use of these classes even without client work, but just a few interface edits. Just adapt to the things you are given from the cache.

Starters should be the lowest leveled equipment you can find for each class.
[hr]
I really would love to help with this btw ;)[/quote]
Same as I said to Docent.

item.title: Class based starters, what should they have?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

I added sort of unimplemented classes to my server. The characters look really cool too. Here are my classes.

Knight - Steel Full Helm, Legends Cape, Holy Symbol, Steel Platebody, Silverlight, Holy Book, Steel Platelegs, Leather Boots, Leather Gloves.

Monk - [No Helm], Holy Symbol, Monk Robe Top, Steel Mace, Holy Book, Monk Robe Bottoms, Leather Boots, Leather Gloves.

Wizard - Blue Wizard Hat, Legends Cape, Amulet of Magic, Wizard Robe Top, Staff of Air, Holy Book, Blue Skirt, Leather Boots, Leather Gloves.

Dark Wizard (Wizard Variant) - Ahrim’s Hood, Zamorak Cape, Unholy Symbol, Dark Wizard Top, Mystic Mud Staff, Unholy Book, Black Skirt, Leather Boots, and Leather Gloves.

Archer - Robin Hood Hat, Holy Symbol, Red Cape, Leather Body, Maple Shortbow, Green D’hide Chaps, Leather Boots, Leather Vambraces.

If you like em you can use em

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Muroth:

original idea – one account, multiple characters i.e three slots, can be three warriors, three skillers, two skillers, one pure, etc

Would not be worth it in the long run.
Plus, you’d have to manage the slots.

Alright, I’ve always been better at the code behind the server. I can never think of what should be in shops, what should be in drops, and definitely what should be in a starter.

I’m have a class-based starter system. Instead of the not-so-classic classic Range, Mage, and Melee starters, I wanted these 3:
Skiller - Pker - Main (Both).

The skiller would (I assume) come with a bit more money than the pker (for raw materials and such), and I think would look like:
4 spots used for [hat][body][legs][boots] (Idk what to put :P)
A tin, a chisel, a knife, Bronze + Iron hatchet and pickaxe, and some a basic starter pack of items (like a few seeds and shit).

Pker:
A set of ghostly, and 2 sets of full rune. Some cash, and some weapons for pvp. Nothing skill related goes in this because, they don’t want skills.

Main:
This would be a mix of the two. Cash, as always, the skiller outfit, the ghostly outfit, and 1 set of rune. Plus some runes, arrows, and a couple scims.

What should I do to improve these, and obviously I need better ideas on the outfits.
